headline.main: Readers Respond to Colombia and Free Trade

docs.abstract: Readers respond to Nicholas D. Kristof's recent column on free trade with Colombia.
docs.lead_paragraph: Many readers challenged some of the ideas in Nick's recent column in support of the U.S.-Colombia free-trade agreement (FTA) - an agreement that both of the Democratic presidential candidates have opposed.
docs.snippet: Readers respond to Nicholas D. Kristof's recent column on free trade with Colombia.

headline.print_headline: Michael White, 59; Used Stories as Therapy
headline.main: Michael White, 59, Dies; Used Stories as Therapy

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. White, a social worker and family therapist, developed a technique known as narrative therapy, which used storytelling to help patients of all ages deal with childhood traumas.
docs.snippet: Mr. White, a social worker and family therapist, developed a technique known as narrative therapy, which used storytelling to help patients of all ages deal with childhood traumas.

headline.print_headline: The Short End Of the Longer Life
headline.main: The Short End of the Longer Life

docs.lead_paragraph: Ever rising longevity is not a given for all Americans anymore, especially women. In some rural counties, lifespans have actually declined.
docs.snippet: Ever rising longevity is not a given for all Americans anymore, especially women. In some rural counties, lifespans have actually declined.

headline.main: Court Delays Posting of Calorie Counts

docs.abstract: A federal appeals judge delayed the enforcement of new city rules requiring calorie counts to be posted in some restaurants.
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals judge on Wednesday delayed the enforcement of new city rules requiring calorie counts to be posted alongside prices in some restaurants. The delay ordered by Judge Robert A. Katzmann is only temporary, until Tuesday, when he said a three-member panel of the Second Circuit Court of Appeals would hear oral arguments on continuing the delay. The regulations had been scheduled to go into effect on Saturday.
docs.snippet: A federal appeals judge delayed the enforcement of new city rules requiring calorie counts to be posted in some restaurants.

headline.print_headline: At Fast-Food Outlets: Premature Sticker Shock for the Weight Conscious
headline.main: At Fast-Food Outlets: Premature Sticker Shock for the Weight Conscious

byline.contributor: Umar Cheema and Sharon Otterman contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: At some coffee shops and fast-food restaurants, the city awoke to what amounted to an accidental pilot program to post calorie counts.
docs.snippet: At some coffee shops and fast-food restaurants, the city awoke to what amounted to an accidental pilot program to post calorie counts.

headline.print_headline: Life Expectancy Is Declining In Some Pockets of the Country
headline.main: Life Expectancy Is Declining in Some Pockets of the Country

docs.lead_paragraph: A new study finds a growing disparity in mortality depending on race, income and geography.
docs.snippet: A new study finds a growing disparity in mortality depending on race, income and geography.

headline.seo: High Blood Pressure - Hypertension: In Retreat, but Hardly Vanquished - Jane E. Brody - Personal Health
headline.print_headline: Hypertension: In Retreat, but Hardly Vanquished
headline.main: Hypertension: In Retreat, but Hardly Vanquished

docs.lead_paragraph: The concept of a normal blood pressure has fallen strikingly as doctors learn what it takes to preserve good health.
docs.snippet: The concept of a normal blood pressure has fallen strikingly as doctors learn what it takes to preserve good health.

headline.print_headline: Calories: Just Part of the Picture
headline.main: Calories: Just Part of the Picture

docs.lead_paragraph: The city health department’s push for rules requiring some restaurants to post calorie counts — and the New York State Restaurant Association’s court fight against those rules — raises a question: How many calories should an average person eat on an average day?.
